ru.jango.j0util

Class RotationUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.OrientationEventListener
      • ru.jango.j0util.RotationUtil

  • public class RotationUtil
extends android.view.OrientationEventListener
    Utility class for device rotation handling. Also wraps OrientationEventListener.

    -- in any time current rotation could be saved and then retrieved
    -- could be managed rotation changes threshold
    See Also:
    rememberOrientation(), setOrientationListener(ru.jango.j0util.RotationUtil.OrientationListener, int), RotationUtil.OrientationListener

      • getNormalizedRememberedOrientation

        public int getNormalizedRememberedOrientation()
        Normalized orientation could be 0, 90, 180 or 270. The closest to the remembered will be chosen.

      • getNormalizedOrientation

        public int getNormalizedOrientation()
        Normalized orientation could be 0, 90, 180 or 270. The closest to the current will be chosen.

      • getOrientationListener

        public RotationUtil.OrientationListener getOrientationListener()

      • getUpdateAspect

        public int getUpdateAspect()
        Returns the rotation changes threshold.
        See Also:
        setOrientationListener(ru.jango.j0util.RotationUtil.OrientationListener, int)

      • setOrientationListener

        public void setOrientationListener(RotationUtil.OrientationListener listener,
                          int updateAspect)
        Set listener to the sensors. updateAspect is a value in degrees, on witch the rotation should change to activate the listener. This way you can vary sensitivity of the the sensors.
        Parameters:
        listener - listener for orientation change callbacks
        updateAspect - rotation changes threshold

      • getLayoutOrientation

        public static int getLayoutOrientation(android.content.Context ctx)
        Returns window orientation.

      • getCameraRotation

        public static int getCameraRotation(android.content.Context ctx)
        Returns rotation angle in degrees, witch should be passed into the Camera.setDisplayOrientation(int) for normal camera preview image scaling.
        See Also:
        Camera

      • getDisplayRotation

        public static int getDisplayRotation(android.content.Context ctx)
        Returns display rotation in degrees, not predefined constants.
        See Also:
        Display.getRotation()
